moves.1. e4: Black plays the Scandinavian aka Center Counter Gambit.  I recently did some book work on how to meet it.  Let's see how it works...
moves.1... d5 2. exd5 Qxd5 3. Nf3 Bg4 4. Be2 N: This was the attacking opportunity I was looking for...so far so good.
moves.7... e5 8. d5 Bb4+ 9. Nc3 a6 10. O-O Nf6: 13. ..., Ng4?? will cost him his Knight.  Let's open up his king first...
moves.14. cxb7+ Kb8 15. h3 Bd4 16. Bxg4 Qg6 17: If he accepts my offer of a 'free' Bishop I have a mate in two starting  with Qxa6...
moves.18... g6 19. b4: The strategy is to continue trying to chase the black's Queen away from defense.
moves.19... f5 20. c5 Qe6: ???  A bid for a Queen trade would have been much better for black  (20. ..., Qb6)
moves.21... Ka7 22. Bd3: I don't think there's anyway way to stop it now...
